text:
When commiting changes with the admin tool, or deploying webapps with manager, 
an extra <Listener ...> tag is added to every context in server.xml.

So over time, server.xml grows and grows!

The Listener entries are all exactly the same.

An example of how this looks in server.xml:

<Context ... >
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Other tags...>
</Context>
<Context ... >
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Listener .../>
  <Other tags...>
</Context>
creator: chris@prepaytec.com
amyroh@apache.org
text: I can't seem to reproduce this bug.  Does anyone else have this problem?

creator: rcasa@bluewin.ch
text:
I am able to reproduce, but only if I create a DefaultContext and I restart 
Tomcat.  A Listener for each context is added in server.xml when I commit 
changes with the admin tool.  A new Listener is then added with the first 
commit changes after each restart.
Yes - I have remove my DefaultContext and the problem no longer occurs.
creator: chris@prepaytec.com

text: Fixed.  Should be available in the next release.
